Research · Teaching · Links · CV · PhD Thesis

I am a postdoctoral researcher working with Péter Koltai and Gary Froyland on applying dynamical systems methods in the context of social dynamics and climate science.

I recently obtained my PhD under Hil Meijer titled ‘Data, models and transitions in computational neuroscience: bottom-up and top-down approaches’ at the University of Twente.

My interests lie in mathematical modeling in physical sciences, dynamical systems and its interaction with machine learning.

News:

  • 10/22 - 11/22: Visiting Gary Froyland at UNSW, Sydney
  • 04/23: Biophysical neural masses and EEG! Preprint here.
  • 05/23: SIAM DS23 MS12: Community detection in temporal dynamics and the Laplace operator
